Create a correlation plot between 2 different QC metrics

Source: R/qc.R
qc_correlation_plot.Rd

This function creates a correlation plot between two given qc metric (or any continuous variable of the Seurat object meta.data).

Usage

qc_correlation_plot(
  seurat_object,
  metric_x = "nCount_RNA",
  metric_y = "nFeature_RNA",
  title = "",
  shape = "orig.ident",
  color = "mitoRatio",
  x_threshold = NULL,
  y_threshold = NULL,
  x_trans = "identity",
  y_trans = "identity"
)

Arguments

seurat_object

Seurat object to use to create the plot.

metric_x

Name of the metric (meta.data column) to plot on x axis. Default to "nCount_RNA".

metric_y

Name of the metric (meta.data column) to plot on y axis. Default to "nFeature_RNA".

title

Title to add to the plot. Default to "".

shape

Name of the column to use to pass to aes(shape) in geom_point. It is used to change the shape of the dots based on values of a meta.data column. Default to "orig.ident".

color

Name of the column to use to pass to aes(color) in geom_point. It is used to change the color of the dots based on values of a meta.data column. Default to "mitoRatio".

x_threshold

Optional value of the threshold line to plot as a vertical line. Default to NULL, not plotted.

y_threshold

Optional value of the threshold line to plot as an horizontal line. Default to NULL, not plotted.

x_trans

Transformation to pass to scale_x_continuous(trans). Default to "identity".

y_trans

Transformation to pass to scale_y_continuous(trans). Default to "identity".

Value

A ggplot list object with the plot.

Examples

data("pbmc_small")
pbmc_small <- calculate_qc_metrics(pbmc_small)

# Basic plot
qc_correlation_plot(pbmc_small)


# Specify x and y metrics
qc_correlation_plot(pbmc_small, metric_x = "mitoRatio",
                    metric_y = "riboRatio")
